newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-India little changed in London.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-India little changed in London.

text.p: Thin trade in Indian global depositary receipts (GDRs) saw the market close little changed as investors awaited results of blue chip Reliance.
"There is a lot of supply planned for this market and that will keep sentiment depressed," said a trader.

The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index JCEAI closed down 0.31 points at 60.99 points, with the premium over the local market at 10.96 after the Bombay Stock Exchange 30-share index rose 7.36 points to 3,112.02.
Reliance continued yesterday's firmer trend ahead of its results on Friday and the GDR ended up 13 cents at $10.05/$10.45, but elsewhere the market was mostly weaker.
"Trade has been thin for some time," said a trader.

Other markets in Asia were almost static as well, the Capel Korea GDR Index ended up 0.35 points at 72.75, a premium of 27.64 percent over the local market after the Korea Composite Index rose 4.56 points to 839.73.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index ended down 0.28 points at 89.89, a premium of 2.17 percent after the Taiwan Weighted Index lost 56.93 points to 6,494.34.
